definition: to get angry/to take offense/angry/vitality/liveliness
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
full of vitality
associated gas (petrochemical engineering)
see 生機盎然|生机盎然[sheng1 yi4 ang4 ran2]
to displease
to be quick to take offence/to have a short fuse
pinyin: dong4 bu5 dong4 jiu4 sheng1 qi4

sentences.english: He jazzed up the room with some bright red curtains.
sentences.chinese: 他用一些鲜红的窗帘将房间装饰得更具生气。

sentences.english: We want someone for the job who has lots of pizzazz .
sentences.chinese: 我们想要有生气的人干这项工作。

sentences.english: It is research that is guaranteed to delight men - and infuriate the women in their lives.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究结果一定会让男人高兴，惹女人生气。

sentences.english: A lot of people are saying, "Enough of this kind of effete culture.
sentences.chinese: 很多人都在说，“我们已经厌倦了这毫无生气的文化。

sentences.english: He was very angry at the remarks made by his teacher.
sentences.chinese: 他对老师的批语很生气。

sentences.english: The president is telling all of these people that he is very angry with Nordstrom.
sentences.chinese: 总统是在告诉所有这些人，他对诺德斯特龙很生气。

sentences.english: and the mother was very, very disturbed.
sentences.chinese: 拿着水枪玩耍，喷得到处都是水，让妈妈非常生气。

sentences.english: He dashed the cup down in his anger.
sentences.chinese: 他生气了，使劲把杯子掷下。

sentences.english: He went outside the walls, sat under a shady plant and sulked.
sentences.chinese: 他走到围墙外面，站在一棵荫凉的植物下生气。

sentences.english: I always made you angry, do not be persuaded, of course, has now admitted the mistake was.
sentences.chinese: 我总是惹你生气，还不听劝，当然现在已经知错了。

sentences.english: I know you’re still mad at me for ditching you off.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你还在为我放你鸽子在生气。

sentences.english: They make the circus lively and cause people to laugh。
sentences.chinese: 他们使马戏充满生气，使观众捧腹大笑。

sentences.english: He said Ms. Choi became upset when she found the dog alone at his home.
sentences.chinese: 他说崔顺实发现小狗独自待在他家以后变得很生气。

sentences.english: I hope I didn't offend you.

to get angry

to go into a huff
to be difficult with sb/to provoke disagreement/at loggerheads/to fall out with
to feel jealous
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
to sulk/to squabble
to feel wronged/to cause sb to feel wronged/grievance
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
to be in a bad mood
to blame/to rebuke
to act in a fit of pique/to get in a huff/to be peeved
